document.title: Hawai ªi Common Core Standards for English Language Arts

F4DDEFB444F7498CBF13AFCB44F35103.description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to texts, including using frequently occurring conjunctions to signal simple relationships (e.g., because).

8F138EAADF574674B5356395F8B353CC.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs differing in manner (e.g., look, peek, glance, stare, glare, scowl) and adjectives differing in intensity (e.g., large, gigantic) by defining or choosing them or by acting out the meanings.

A8359412BD8B4DC09CD6316E939240F6.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at home that are cozy).

42E9C8766CFC43F8A3832CD3846CB0AF.description: Define words by category and by one or more key attributes (e.g., a duck is a bird that swims; a tiger is a large cat with stripes).

53DB464FD25047CF828DC47DF4AE4E15.description: Sort words into categories (e.g., colors, clothing) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

A5F6B91F8C014E3F891AEDF63A30723D.description: With guidance and support from adults, demonstrate understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings:

E3ED83B754244234A26F4B1277CCF3ED.description: Identify frequently occurring root words (e.g., look) and their inflectional forms (e.g., looks, looked, looking).

02B49793B46046E88D7CB79D822AEB50.description: Use frequently occurring affixes as a clue to the meaning of a word.

ABEF168B87754B8EB8C4D0F47BAD3B56.description: Use sentence-level context as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

074DFD91723E4DA3B2FE77E831C81540.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 1 reading and content, choosing flexibly from an array of strategies:

47BFBA99CEF745949F01D7D77076A793.description: Produce and expand complete simple and compound declarative, interrogative, imperative, and exclamatory sentences in response to prompts.

C4276B6DE62C437E96A3959B161CD73F.description: Use frequently occurring prepositions (e.g., during, beyond, toward).

A8F23EF0C84A4CA2801B9077C60D4CDE.description: Use frequently occurring conjunctions (e.g., and, but, or, so, because).

2CCAB6C3520343388647C5F46921D810.description: Use verbs to convey a sense of past, present, and future (e.g., Yesterday I walked home; Today I walk home; Tomorrow I will walk home).

CEC32453C72146FF9ED3906A1057515A.description: Use personal, possessive, and indefinite pronouns (e.g., I, me, my; they, them, their; anyone, everything).

95B1FA565E934235AF8B359D4230C82C.description: Use singular and plural nouns with matching verbs in basic sentences (e.g., He hops; We hop).

D93D4EF612E94C3EAE4E24BEEBB29C6C.description: Use common, proper, and possessive nouns.

A63469A07CD94248ACA265CECE0C56F0.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of English grammar and usage when reading, writing, or speaking:

5FD252687AC044EAB91CF7A782A37405.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts, demonstrating understanding of audience, task, and purpose, drawing on a full range of linguistic skills.

B91339A81334493BB9702076CCF03DD1.description: Describe people, places, things, and events with relevant details, expressing ideas and feelings clearly.

5E14064627224B9CA3D89E3EA493FB91.description: Ask and answer questions about what a speaker says in order to gather additional information or clarify something that is not understood.

4C6994E4F58F4DAE88F254F149959935.description: Ask and answer questions about key details in a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media.

A79B262BF38D44479F8D867115E4E45E.description: Ask questions to clear up any confusion about the topics and texts under discussion.

C43689C22159473C8D0F9B95E81DC098.description: Build on others‚Äô talk in conversations by responding to the comments of others through multiple exchanges.

4ED68B98421042FFABC0864C9B631A8D.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to others with care, speaking one at a time about the topics and texts under discussion).

2B591A8475CA49429D4FA829B0C5E3CC.description: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about grade 1 topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups:

90EEF0AB251C449A854914D306F68767.description: With guidance and support from adults, recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

01A9D5C2399B49D4B06036B98B64936C.description: Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore a number of ‚Äúhow-to‚Äù books on a given topic and use them to write a sequence of instructions):

BE10381A0EDB4511B889D9E9022FC55A.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

B366CE0CEB34462599324EA312B16A2D.description: With guidance and support from adults, use a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in collaboration with peers.

5AFF2FCC041F455FA190184F579CED2B.description: With guidance and support from adults, focus on a topic, respond to questions and suggestions from peers, and add details to strengthen writing as needed.

7782307817B04EB8AF5CEDD3AE85C010.description: Write narratives in which they recount two or more appropriately sequenced events, include some details regarding what happened, use temporal words to signal event order, and provide some sense of closure.

C64D9381B6D94BD4BD78FC0FE01990BC.description: Write informative/explanatory texts in which they name a topic, supply some facts about the topic, and provide some sense of closure.

DDF30C43BF0440E490133915EBB9EA8E.description: Write opinion pieces in which they introduce the topic or name the book they are writing about, state an opinion, supply a reason for the opinion, and provide some sense of closure.

BE45B4FD48A04A58BF840378979D4F39.description: Use commas in dates and to separate single words in a series.

C40BD4CB59C14B3E8C7C4C83BDA739B4.description: Use correct end punctuation for sentences.

F7CFE6CBE6EE411E816A125C2DE372AC.description: Capitalize dates and names of people.

5FF90D37F718499F8067AF16C2DA162F.description: Produce and expand declarative, interrogative, imperative, and exclamatory sentences in response to prompts.

4DEB3BFFAEB14601A25AD2BE39D08553.description: Produce and expand complete simple and compound sentences in response to prompts.

0F54A801F0E44B0CA04E51592D35994F.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of English when writing sentences and single paragraphs:

0E8BF4401A944B95A97CBD04EC83A2EB.description: Spell common, grade-appropriate decodable and irregularly-spelled high-frequency words.

88FF8B8395304C3D9C54B29628A84C32.description: Long vowel patterns spelled correctly, including VCe (Vowel-Consonant-silent e) (e.g., came, like) and open syllables (e.g., go, cry)

209960351C0F4C2C941E5637C0FAA012.description: Initial and final consonant blends (e.g., must, slab, plump)

234FEC9B5C824293870D4457B071A33A.description: Digraphs (e.g., thin, shop, when, much, sing)

2C9755536B934629AA3016AEA6D8FEEF.description: Consonant graphemes including qu, x, and -ck

6148407B166049B5B119AA4A9618C2CE.description: Spell common, regular, single-syllable words using:

A26246A1D06D4EC1A2E9AFEF41104895.description: Know and apply phonics and word analysis skills when encoding words:

E9DCBEBFDE9E456CB41EA9716A9A0348.description: Write with appropriate spacing between letters and words.

D3AD0BC9AE0C4114B5FEA4893ABDA002.description: Write the common grapheme (letter or letter group) for each phoneme.

1CC2B0E51E2C44ED97F14D7E5358D94A.description: Write upper- and lowercase manuscript alphabet from memory using correct letter formation.

5F5322A4301747A7AB6E8122292615B6.description: Demonstrate and apply correct handwriting skills:

E3C9F60924784820839CD9D3A37FD0D8.description: With prompting and support, read literary texts appropriately complex for grade 1.

0243D5F19AFB4EEC85C1E8A54F4AEA63.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

797668002815442B968C8630AD2FA5AF.description: Compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in stories.

561A26AA0FE14AD09FDBAD95AEA62491.description: Use illustrations and details in a story to describe its characters, setting, or events.

D624E99492A744F397F139674415AF4C.description: Identify who is telling the story at various points in a text.

74E4C69D29C74AE5970BD7460E2DE4F8.description: Explain major differences between books that tell stories and books that give information, drawing  on a wide reading of a range of text types.

39AAC0E9DE84443584503A9D9D839B8C.description: Identify words and phrases in stories or poems that suggest feelings or appeal to the senses.

E5D34C2A739F4F059BFFA3E4165B7F1A.description: Using key details, describe characters and their feelings, settings, major events (plot), problems, and solutions in a story.

7057CE4660AD419597A139BC9975FE68.description: Demonstrate understanding of the lesson in the story.

7446EA4080474A5D83510514E533879E.description: Ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

A19220D0A971423392C2B9FB6B03CD87.description: With prompting and support, read informational texts appropriately complex for grade 1.

662F241B3ECB48938CE334AB93237ADE.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

4EEF7E446A214A4E848FB3E0521B9161.description: Identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts on the same topic (e.g., in illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).

1DDCE05EC5B24177B65B7A26FC49F146.description: Identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

AFA55377B0904B59AF786187460939D2.description: Use the visual aids and details in a text to describe its key ideas.

FFF848636F3D4E449C0791B553F81213.description: Distinguish between information provided by pictures or other illustrations and information provided by the words in a text.

4275B96347744EC984993DDDDEF352D3.description: Know and use various text features (e.g., headings, tables of contents, glossaries, electronic menus, icons) to locate key facts or information in a text.

DFE24E5C366C4F2F90244DD4E6F981AE.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 1 topic or subject area.

4D062A061B1D46FD95E59523FF1E593B.description: Describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

715381B6CA6D4FFD9F137E7A411289E8.description: Retell key details of a text.

BE7B3F8C200D4CEC9A4A6F79DD795D4E.description: Identify the main/central topic of a text.

983C0547D5A646CB9114B7851C4A5111.description: Ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

3024B1713A554D9F9A4FFF755103911F.description: Read grade-level text orally with fluency (accuracy, automaticity, and prosody) to support comprehension, in accordance with grade-level fluency norms.

0BDC33BEDDFB441986F25320A6FFBA31.description: Read common, grade-appropriate decodable and irregularly-spelled high-frequency words by sight (e.g., eat, can, the, of, to, you, she, my, is, are, do, does).

966E22B1B60647148C19BAA8742FF0D3.description: Use knowledge that every syllable must have a vowel sound to determine the number of syllables in a printed word.

ABE72FC12A084D7884066B56FA70540B.description: Inflectional Suffixes with no spelling change (e.g., help, helps, helped, helping)

1C26CF6C201545C19B1E90E947258E7A.description: R-Controlled Vowels (ar, er, ir, or, ur)

C5486C954F504573B67748182E196E9C.description: Digraphs (sh, ch, wh, th, ng, ck)

EE114D47296D4847ACF6DD7B43136F33.description: Short vowel words with CVC, CCVC, CVCC, and CCVCC patterns

845BCECB568C446EAF8B4BE37F45B46C.description: Read regularly spelled one and two-syllable words in isolation and in text, including:

0C98015B77FD444C8912F939EC14F7B4.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills to read:

B51DED2CF5CC426CBEBA9F3BD26D4DB4.description: Add, delete, or substitute (in words with 5-6 phonemes) individual sounds (phonemes) in initial and final positions in simple, one-syllable words to make new words.

34B38D6EC36947678DB546E48959823F.description: Segment spoken single-syllable words into their complete sequence of individual sounds (phonemes), including short and long vowel sounds.

F4B588652C3043B68D985FE774BB45AB.description: Isolate and pronounce initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in spoken single-syllable words.

80D7391A56DE4731B174A6DD379A3140.description: Blend sounds (phonemes) to orally produce single-syllable words, including short and long vowel sounds, consonant blends, digraphs, and diphthongs.

6685A536D68E492DB03E5FE54AF7C0FC.description: Add, delete, and substitute syllables in multisyllabic words.

2B7560BC615649EC876EA24D6BF6AA4F.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes):

2F4CEF318C4E467CB0A0D966D20B2801.description: Recognize the meaning of a comma within text.

DA574426E5AC482AB6FE85109DD5FF47.description: Recognize the meaning of ending punctuation.

AE2A64A16F2A48ADBF0901705A103DE4.description: Recognize the capitalization of proper nouns.

D5F1FB4F14B84F1EB26B1C614B308A71.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print:
